node.name: BASIC
node.rich_text:
Enter password: Welcome to the MariaDB monitor. Commands end with ; or \g. Your MariaDB connection id is 31 Server version: 11.8.2-MariaDB-1 from Debian -- Please help get to 10k stars at https://github.com/MariaDB/Server
Copyright (c) 2000, 2018, Oracle, MariaDB Corporation Ab and others.
Type 'help;' or '\h' for help. Type '\c' to clear the current input statement.
MariaDB [(none)]> ^C MariaDB [(none)]>

+--------------------+ | Database | +--------------------+ | information_schema | | mysql | | performance_schema | | sys | +--------------------+ 4 rows in set (0.005 sec)
MariaDB [(none)]>

Query OK, 1 row affected (0.000 sec)
MariaDB [(none)]>

+--------------------+ | Database | +--------------------+ | information_schema | | my_database | | mysql | | performance_schema | | sys | +--------------------+ 5 rows in set (0.001 sec)
MariaDB [(none)]>
create table my_table( -> id int primary key, -> name varchar(50), -> age int -> );

Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.009 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]>
ERROR 1064 (42000): You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MariaDB server version for the right syntax to use near '' at line 1 MariaDB [my_database]>

+-----------------------+ | Tables_in_my_database | +-----------------------+ | my_table | +-----------------------+ 1 row in set (0.001 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]> select * from my_table -> ^C MariaDB [my_database]>

Query OK, 1 row affected (0.001 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]> select * from my_table; +----+------+------+ | id | name | age | +----+------+------+ | 1 | john | 24 | +----+------+------+ 1 row in set (0.000 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]> insert into my_table (id, name,age) values (2,'johnny',34); Query OK, 1 row affected (0.001 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]> insert into my_table (id, name,age) values (3,'joe',34); Query OK, 1 row affected (0.001 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]> select * from my_table; +----+--------+------+ | id | name | age | +----+--------+------+ | 1 | john | 24 | | 2 | johnny | 34 | | 3 | joe | 34 | +----+--------+------+ 3 rows in set (0.000 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]>
update my_table set age = 23 where id = 2;

Query OK, 1 row affected (0.001 sec) Rows matched: 1 Changed: 1 Warnings: 0
MariaDB [my_database]>

Query OK, 1 row affected (0.001 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]> select * from my_table; +----+--------+------+ | id | name | age | +----+--------+------+ | 2 | johnny | 23 | | 3 | joe | 34 | +----+--------+------+ 2 rows in set (0.001 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]>

ERROR 1064 (42000): You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MariaDB server version for the right syntax to use near '' at line 1 MariaDB [my_database]> drop table my_table -> ^C MariaDB [my_database]>

Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.004 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]> show tables; Empty set (0.000 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]> show databases; +--------------------+ | Database | +--------------------+ | information_schema | | my_database | | mysql | | performance_schema | | sys | +--------------------+ 5 rows in set (0.001 sec)
MariaDB [my_database]> use mysql; Reading table information for completion of table and column names You can turn off this feature to get a quicker startup with -A
Database changed MariaDB

Query OK, 0 rows affected (0.002 sec)
MariaDB [mysql]>
